1.text: Hath not man a life of labour upon earth? and are not his days like the days of a hireling?

2.text: As a bondman earnestly desireth the shadow, and a hireling expecteth his wages,

3.text: So am I made to possess months of vanity, and wearisome nights are appointed to me.

4.text: If I lie down, I say, When shall I rise up, and the darkness be gone? and I am full of tossings until the dawn.

5.text: My flesh is clothed with worms and clods of dust; my skin is broken, and suppurates.

6.text: My days are swifter than a weaverâ€™s shuttle, and are spent without hope.

7.text: Remember thou that my life is wind; mine eye shall no more see good.

8.text: The eye of him that hath seen me shall behold me no [more]: thine eyes are upon me, and I am not.

9.text: The cloud consumeth and vanisheth away; so he that goeth down to Sheol shall not come up.

10.text: He shall return no more to his house, neither shall his place know him again.

11.text: Therefore I will not restrain my mouth: I will speak in the anguish of my spirit; I will complain in the bitterness of my soul.

12.text: Am I a sea, or a sea-monster, that thou settest a watch over me?

13.text: When I say, My bed shall comfort me, my couch shall ease my complaint;

14.text: Then thou scarest me with dreams, and terrifiest me through visions;

15.text: So that my soul chooseth strangling, death, rather than my bones.

16.text: I loathe it; I shall not live always: let me alone, for my days are a breath.

17.text: What is man, that thou makest much of him? and that thou settest thy heart upon him?

18.text: And that thou visitest him every morning, triest him every moment?

19.text: How long wilt thou not look away from me, nor let me alone till I swallow down my spittle?

20.text: Have I sinned, what do I unto thee, thou Observer of men? Why hast thou set me as an object of assault for thee, so that I am become a burden to myself?

21.text: And why dost not thou forgive my transgression and take away mine iniquity? for now shall I lie down in the dust, and thou shalt seek me early, and I shall not be.
